title: Car Rentals: Dual Pricing (Per-km & Per-day), With/Without Driver, Most Popular Badge, T&C Integration

requirements.text: Update the Car Rentals page vehicle cards to display two pricing modes for each vehicle: per-km and per-day. Sedan: ₹13/km and ₹2,500/day (mark with a 'Most Popular' badge). SUV: ₹21/km and ₹5,000/day. Each vehicle card must clearly present both pricing options so the user can see and select the mode they prefer.

quotes: Give 2 options for car division 13 rupees per km and 2500 per day for sedan with and without driver and 21 rupees km for suv and 5000 rupees per day for suv with and without driver and keep sedan in most popular segment

acceptanceCriteria: Sedan card displays ₹13/km and ₹2,500/day as two distinct pricing options
SUV card displays ₹21/km and ₹5,000/day as two distinct pricing options
Sedan card is visually highlighted with a 'Most Popular' badge
Both vehicle types show 'With Driver' and 'Without Driver' options
Pricing mode selection (per-km vs per-day) is clearly interactive and visually distinct

requirements.text: Update the Car Rentals booking form fare estimator to support both pricing modes. When 'per-km' mode is selected, capture estimated distance in km and calculate fare using Sedan ₹13/km or SUV ₹21/km. When 'per-day' mode is selected, capture number of days and calculate fare using Sedan ₹2,500/day or SUV ₹5,000/day. Display the estimated fare dynamically as the user inputs values. Store the selected pricing mode, distance/days, and estimated fare in the car rental inquiry submitted to the backend.

quotes: 13 rupees per km and 2500 per day for sedan
21 rupees km for suv and 5000 rupees per day for suv

acceptanceCriteria: Per-km mode: inputting distance calculates and displays estimated fare using the correct rate (₹13/km for Sedan, ₹21/km for SUV)
Per-day mode: inputting number of days calculates and displays estimated fare using the correct rate (₹2,500/day for Sedan, ₹5,000/day for SUV)
Estimated fare updates dynamically as the user types
Selected pricing mode, input value (distance or days), and estimated fare are submitted with the inquiry to the backend
Backend stores the pricing mode, distance/days, and estimated fare in the car rental inquiry record

requirements.text: Ensure the Car Rentals booking form includes the existing T&C checkbox acknowledgment that the user must check before submitting. The checkbox must link to the Terms & Conditions page and prominently display the notice: 'Without driver — if anything happens to the vehicle, the consumer is fully liable for all repair and associated costs.' The form must not be submittable unless the checkbox is checked.
acceptanceCriteria: A T&C acknowledgment checkbox is visible on the Car Rentals booking form
The checkbox label or adjacent text states: 'Without driver — if anything happens to the vehicle, the consumer is fully liable for all repair and associated costs'
The checkbox includes or is adjacent to a link to the Terms & Conditions page
The form submit button is disabled or shows a validation error if the checkbox is not checked
The T&C page remains accessible from the footer

requirements.text: Refresh the Car Rentals page UI to be more premium and user-friendly: improve card layout typography hierarchy, use clean borders and subtle background contrasts (no box shadows), ensure vehicle selection, pricing mode toggle, driver option, and booking form are laid out clearly and responsively on both mobile and desktop, consistent with the overall black/white/grey premium MakeMyTrip/Uber aesthetic.

quotes: make it look more user friendly and premium

acceptanceCriteria: Car Rentals page has no box shadows; depth is conveyed via borders and background contrasts
Vehicle cards have a clear, polished layout with readable typography hierarchy
Pricing mode toggle (per-km / per-day), driver option (with/without), and fare estimator inputs are visually grouped and easy to follow
Page is fully responsive on mobile and desktop
Visual style is consistent with the overall black/white/grey premium palette used across the site

constraints: Do not change the backend inquiry data model schema beyond storing the pricing mode, distance/days, and estimated fare fields already introduced for car rental inquiries
Do not modify files listed in frontend.immutablePaths
T&C page content must not be removed or altered; only ensure it is linked correctly from the car rentals form
nonGoals: Adding new vehicle types beyond Sedan and SUV
Real-time GPS or live distance tracking
Payment processing or online payment integration
